it.polimi.se2019.server.net

Class CommandHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2019.util.Observable<Request>
      • it.polimi.se2019.server.net.CommandHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer<Response>, java.io.Serializable

    public class CommandHandler
extends Observable<Request>
implements Observer<Response>
    The CommandHandler act as a virtual view. The command handler is in charge to wrap the network, it provides methods when we receive a message and to send a message
    Author:
    FF
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Nested Classes

      class  CommandHandler.TargetableNotFoundException
      Not found exception, could be thrown when we convert a reference message to a real object message

    • Method Detail

      • convertNetMessage

        public InternalMessage convertNetMessage(NetMessage netMessage,
                                         Game game)
                                  throws CommandHandler.TargetableNotFoundException
        This method is used to convert an id to the object reference it refers. It needs to cycle through all the possible objects of the game to find it. Il looks for players, tiles, ammocrates, powerup or weapons.
        Parameters:
        netMessage - the unconverted message
        game - the game
        Returns:
        the converted message
        Throws:
        CommandHandler.TargetableNotFoundException - if it does not find a target

      • handle

        public void handle(Request request)
        This handles the call from the client, in particular if a client is trying to connect (or reconnect) it puts him into the waitinglist or reconnects him to the game. If a client is not connecting it could be a pong (that is managed here) or a normale request that is processed by the controller
        Parameters:
        request - the request

      • handleLocalRequest

        public void handleLocalRequest(Request request)
        A method used to notify the controller, similar to the normal handle, but more stripped
        Parameters:
        request - the request

      • update

        public void update(Response response)
            throws Observer.CommunicationError
        This is where you send a model update to a client, the model notify and this sends to the clients. It is buffered in here to allow a better network management.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Observer<Response>
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        Throws:
        Observer.CommunicationError - if the network has a problem

      • addUpdateToBuffer

        public void addUpdateToBuffer(StateUpdate stateUpdate)
        The buffer adder
        Parameters:
        stateUpdate - the update

      • resetBuffer

        public void resetBuffer()
        The buffer rest

      • sendBuffer

        public void sendBuffer()
                throws Observer.CommunicationError
        The buffer sender
        Throws:
        Observer.CommunicationError - if the network has a problem

      • sendResponse

        public void sendResponse(Response response)
                  throws Observer.CommunicationError
        This is where we communicate to the client, we send a message to it. The rmi implementation uses threads to make it non blocking. Disconnections are handled using the pinger daemon.
        Parameters:
        response - the response
        Throws:
        Observer.CommunicationError - if the network has a problem

      • ping

        public void ping()
          throws Observer.CommunicationError
        Just the ping sender and processing, sends and waits for response
        Throws:
        Observer.CommunicationError - if the network has a problem
